intro: Astragalus ovallensis, commonly known as the oval milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus ovallensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
